titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Education and Research, Public Education, Office Files of Marjorie Martus
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Education and Research, Public Education, Office Files of Marjorie Martus FA714
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Daniel Bruce May, Ford Foundation Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-26 19:54:06 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Education and Research, Public Education, Office Files of Marjorie Martus

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material more than ten years old is open for scholarly research.
Select individual files are restricted, as noted. Permission to access these files must be obtained from the Ford Foundation before scholarly access is permitted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.
Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Staff and consultant reports and publications have been transferred to the appropriate collections. Crossreference sheets located within the folders, denote the new locations of these items which are listed in the back of this register. Papers not related to Ford Foundation activities have been removed.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Marjorie Martus, Ford Foundation Program Officer in the Division of Education and Research (E&R), was a member of the Foundation staff from 1958 until 1982.
During this period, she held the following positions:

• October 1977, Program Officer, Division of Education and Research • October 1968, Program Officer, PE (Public Education), Division of Education and Research • October 1967, Assistant Program Officer, Division of Education and Research • January 1967, Program Assistant, PE, Division of Education and Research • October 1965, Program Assistant, Education Program • January 1958, Research Assistant, Education Program

Marjorie Martus was born July 13, 1923. She received her B.A. degree in 1945 from Antioch College. She did additional course work at Columbia University, New York University, and the Bank Street College of Education.
Prior to Martus' career with the Ford Foundation, she held the following positions:

• 1945-1946, Office of War Information, Information Specialist • 1946-1948, U.S. Department of State, Divisional Assistant, Division of International Exchange of Persons • 1948-1954, United States Government, Technical Assistance Specialist; Economic Cooperation Administration, The Hague, The Netherlands • 1954-1955, Douglas Williams Associates, Office Manager; Interviewer • 1955-1956, Milliontex, Inc., Officer Manager • 1956-1957, Rockefeller Bros. Fund, Staff Assistant
Following her retirement from the Ford Foundation, Miss Martus was employed by the School of Education at Stanford University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Education and Research/Public Education Papers of Marjorie Martus were transferred to the Ford Foundation Archives in 1982.

The seven boxes of correspondence and reports which constitute the Education and Research/Public Education Papers of Marjorie Martus, document her activities and a number of those of the Education Program for the years 1962 to 1968; and from 1971 to 1975.

The papers include material related to Ford Foundation educational activities and projects; and correspondence with Foundation colleagues, and individuals in academic, grantee and other organizations.

The papers are broad in scope, but are rather disappointingly superficial, especially in light of Miss Martus' activity and reputation. It is recommended that the researcher consult the files of grants for which Miss Martus served as Responsible Program Officer, a list of which is included in the appendix to this register.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Education and Research/Public Education Papers of Marjorie Martus are divided into two series:
I. Correspondence Files, 1962-1968, 1971-1975 II. Subject Files, 1962-1968
Arrangement within each series corresponds as closely as possible to the original order established by Martus' office.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I, Correspondence Files (1962-1968; 1971-1975), contains correspondence generated by Miss Martus during her years at the Foundation. The correspondence is divided into two subseries:
A. Chronological Files, which are arranged in reverse calendar order; and
B. Alphabetical Files, which are arranged in alphabetical order by correspondent. Within each Alphabetical File folder, the papers are arranged in reverse chronological order

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II, Subject Files (1962-1968), consists of correspondence and other material as it relates to each topic. The files are arranged in alphabetical order. Within each folder, the papers are arranged in reverse chronological order.

Appendix A: Marjorie Martus Reports Removed

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following list of unpublished Ford Foundation reports by Marjorie Martus were removed from the papers. They are listed in alphabetical order. The number at the left, is the assigned accession number. They have been transferred to the Foundation's Archives collection of staff and consultant reports.

Appendix B: Other FF Reports Removed

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following list of unpublished reports written by other FF staff and consultants were removed from the papers. They are listed alphabetically by author. For each author, the reports are arranged in alphabetical order. The number at the left, is the assigned accession number. They have been transferred to the Foundation's Archives collection of staff and consultant reports.
